content.text:
I don’t think I could recommend a product more than I recommend Arrow. The lift tracker makes keeping your lifts consistent and progressively overloading exercises easy while still offering the flexibility to modify your lifts on the fly. You can use this to set up a strictly regimented routine or simply turn it on when you walk in to the gym with no plan and track your lift.

The achievements and social aspect gamify lifting in an extremely fun way. I often find myself hitting a PR just to unlock a new trophy and I love keeping up with my friends’ progress in the gym.

Beyond literally learning the basics of lifting, downloading Arrow has been the best thing I’ve ever done to enhance my progress in the gym.

title: Swapping Out Exercises in My Workouts

content.text:
The app has been a lifesaver so far. It’s helped me track more accurately what areas I’ve been training the most, and it ensures I don’t skip any important muscles. Thank you for that.

However, I do want to make a suggestion. I make My Workouts for different days I go and different muscle I want to workout. It’s great to not have to think about what I have to do that day. The issue is that it’s common to find that a machine is busy, and it best to move on to another exercise or swapping it out with a different exercise. Unfortunately, in order to do that, I have to delete ALL the exercises I had planned already. 

Is there a way the team can consider adding an option in the corner of the exercise where you can swap it out for another one? That way I don’t have to add all the exercises again! It can just replace the one I want to change! That would be the only thing I would like to be changed.

Thank you again to your team for the awesome app.

content.text:
I love the app so far; however, it has some issues for me.

A week time period should be added to the muscle distribution, stats, and favorite workouts I would love to be able to go about my workouts week by week with muscle distribution, like if I didn’t hit shoulders as hard as triceps I could see that without having to dig through my workouts 

I’d like to be able to distinguish my warm up sets over working sets, have a box or even center the warmup sets and that way you could even add more trophies, “1000 club warmup” or somthing cool like that (even though I’m ages away from that)

There needs to be a way to add a drop set, like have a indented box below the main workout that way you’re not doing 10 sets your doing 4 also another chance for some trophies “drop set master”

There should be a way to add supersets just like drop sets, where it’s indented in with the workout your super setting obviously with sets and reps just like drop sets trophies can be added

Just have more exercises available and have more variations of workouts like deficit or banded deadlifts, and benches even squats
 
Make timing workouts not premium, I get somethings should be on premium but that shouldn’t. It’s essential to properly working out and tracking your workouts so if you use a phone timer it won’t help if your looking back and seeing what you’ve done with rest times and workout times

I really hope the devs see this

I really want this app to succeed, I’ve tried different apps and even when you are able to add drop sets or super sets they don’t do everything else quite like this app.

title: A Powerful Workout Tracker with a Small Glitch

content.text:
This fitness app has quickly become an essential part of my workout routine. I love how it tracks each of my sessions and logs them for historical reference. One of the standout features is the body diagram that highlights which muscle groups I’ve hit during the week. It's a great visual way to see where I’ve been focusing and where I need more work. Additionally, the app shows the total volume of weight I’ve lifted, making it easy to track how much I've progressed over time. The data doesn’t stop there—it also breaks down the percentage of body and muscle groups that I tend to hit the most, which is a great way to balance my workouts.

Another thing that keeps me engaged is how the app calculates and tracks my XP, leveling me up based on my efforts. While it doesn’t necessarily affect my workouts, it’s a fun motivator that tricks my brain into staying consistent—like earning daily points in a game. However, the one drawback I’ve found is that if the app closes or restarts unexpectedly, it prompts me to either resume or end the workout. If I choose "end the workout," that session won’t get logged. I’ve learned to hit "resume" and then immediately end the workout to ensure it gets recorded, but that extra step can be annoying.

Despite that small issue, I find this app incredibly motivating. It offers the right balance of data-driven insights, visual tools, and gamified rewards to keep me pushing toward my fitness goals.

title: Great app to track your workouts and progress

content.text: This app is phenomenally great it tracks your workouts gives you a estimated one rep max from the data you put in, gives you overall stats on where your strengths and weaknesses are at. Tells you what muscle groups the workout you put it like the agonist and antagonist muscle. Now the reasons why I rated it 3 star instead of 4 or 5 there are workouts that don’t target said muscle that the name states, as well when you try to add a friend and redeem that extra VIP access which is super nice. There’s also no stretching workouts that can be logged it’s more weight and machine based, not saying there isn’t workouts that use BW(body weight) it’s just that there isn’t many which is a downside.

title: W app , just a little bug

content.text:
I've been using this exercise tracking app for over six months, and it has truly been a game-changer for me. The app is user-friendly, comprehensive, and keeps me motivated by accurately tracking my progress over time.

however , there's one bug that I've noticed which has been a bit of a hassle. When I try to log my workouts on the "Assisted Pull Up/Dips Machine," the app mistakenly adds the assistance weight to my body weight instead of subtracting it. For instance, if I use 30kg assistance, the app adds 30kg to my body weight, resulting in an inaccurate and inflated total weight. 

Despite this issue, I want to express my thanks to the developers for creating such a great app. I hope this little bug can be resolved in a future update.

content.text:
I’ve been using this app to track my workouts for the past couple of months, and it’s quickly become a big part of my fitness routine. Everything about it is just so easy to use, from logging each exercise to navigating the app itself. I’ve also found that the trophies, levels, and other little rewards really help keep me motivated. Every time I hit a new level or earn a trophy, it gives me that extra push to stay consistent and aim for even better results.

One thing I love is how detailed the app gets with your progress. It lets you see how many workouts you’ve done, check out your stats, and even break down how your muscles are being worked over time, which is super cool. Plus, the feature that lets you plan your workouts in advance has been a game-changer for me. It’s so convenient to have everything organized and ready to go, helping me stay on track with my goals.

And on top of all that, there’s a great community on the app that makes the whole experience even better. Sharing progress and seeing others’ achievements adds a fun, social aspect to my fitness journey. Overall, I really love this app, and I know I’ll be sticking with it for the long haul.

title: Awesome app, just missing a few features.

content.text:
As someone who already consistently works out, this app is awesome for keeping you motivated and helping you progress in the gym. I’ve just been using the free version and it works great. For any type of lifter, this app can keep you motivated and make the gym a little more fun. However, it is missing a few features that make it a little annoying to use.

First, once you add exercises  to your workout, you cannot reorder them. This can make it a little harder to do some on the fly workouts and makes them a little harder to track. Second, you cannot change your workout time. This does seem like a big deal until you forget to turn your workout off at the end, which i’ve do a few times, which can then affect your workout time stats. Other than these small quality of life things, this app is awesome.

title: App is good but why add pay wall on basic workouts

content.text:
I started this app 2 weeks ago and it’s great I can see my progress I can get achievements to motivate me it’s perfect. 

I wish the app also could connect to my health app but maybe in the future.  

But recently I had to pay to use the rest timer, which is fine, but then it wanted to me to pay to log in the cardio workout. Why should I have to pay to log in a simple workout like a run? I get if it’s for more things like archery or rock climbing if I have to pay for those, or even adding your own exercise, but for a simple run? It’s stupid i always run a mile before workouts so it’s a pain to have to pay to log in a 20min treadmill run.

content.text:
For those thinking about getting this app:

This app is an absolute amazing tool, the functionality of it and the ability to even see your progression over time for a particular exercise…. this takes almost EVERYTHING that I used to keep track of myself and puts it in a nice format that is easy to read.  I also like how it shows your total volume lifted, that’s a neat little feature and there a loads more that are just cool to see the number increase. The diagram showing muscle groups worked over time is AWESOME and actually really helpful to see any particular muscle groups I may be unintentionally neglecting. 

Just a heads up it can be a little confusing to use the first couple times of using it but honestly after like a week and half it becomes second nature. The UI could definitely use some work but it is not terrible by any means necessary and really you can tell that this is a new app…its bound to have some small issues. 

I have not noticed a SINGLE glitch which is something that makes me delete apps asap if they are prone to glitch out, not a single one so far from this app. 

This is the first app review I have ever left but this app has been so beneficial to me and the potential is so great I just had to leave one. 

The only “improvements” I could see are some updates to the UI, the ability to have a workout pre saved that way you don’t have to put in a singular exercise everytime. Just having a “save this workout” feature that you can then use the next time it comes around would be awesome.

The only “improvements” I could see are some updates to the UI, the ability to have a workout pre saved that way you don’t have to put in a singular exercise everytime. Just having a “save this workout” feature that you can then use the next time it comes around would be awesome.

title: A Necessity: Helpful and Fun to use

content.text:
For months, my best friend tried to convince me to use this app. I had already been hitting the gym consistently for two years at that point. I refused, believing I could manage on my own.

Oh boy was I wrong.

I gave the app a try, and much to my chagrin, I had been missing entire sections of my body when working out. I decided to make Levels a habit, and now I simply do not workout without it.

Not only can I track my PRs, but I can thoroughly ensure that I am working muscles that I intend to. Just recently they added a section for timed workouts which is a blessing. Best of all, I can remember which workout I’m on because I can look back two weeks for my workout history. 

My absolute favorite part is the competition against my best friend. I added him using the snazzy friend system, and now he’s under my microscope. That man shan’t forget his leg day anymore. 

Alas, I digress. I recommend you give Levels a chance. If you don’t like it, delete it. However, after a couple levels and friends, you’ll be looking forward to pulling more weight and producing growth to outpace everyone. Goodluck, don’t skip cardio.

title: Awesome app! Some feedback for the developers

content.text:
I got this app recently and I think the idea is genius! Some feedback on features that I and my friends think would be useful:
- adding the ability to create custom exercises that way, if we’re doing cardio or an obscure exercise that doesn’t exist in the catalog, we can still log it 
- create an iOS Home Screen widget so we can see which muscles we have and haven’t worked this week without needing to open the app! If I’m feeling demotivated, I’ll typically avoid such an app, but if it’s thrown in my face that I’ve worked out everything except abs lately whenever I open my phone, I’ll feel compelled to just get the ab workout done

title: Solid app Needs to be simplified

content.text: The app itself is really cool and interesting being able to see what you’ve done that week and others. But having to start a workout every day and taking notes mid lift is more difficult than necessary I believe. Since you already have the workout designed in app and added we should be able to add that lift to our day at the press of a button and have it logged. Obviously then we would need to input Time weight sets etc but atleast this way people can show as much or as little of their workouts as they want and not need to open their phone in between every set when they’re cracked off pre workout.

content.text:
Pros:
- I love that it’s free
- I like that there is a friends system so I can tell my homies they are slacking
- Let’s me plan my workouts, and change them on the fly
- Color scheme is pretty cool, although customization would be cool
- Compete with all your friends
- Metric/Imperial, for world wide use or the traveling users
- Lots of different exercises, weights, body weight, etc.

Cons:
- I understand this is a weight lifting app, but any lifter knows Cardio is just as important, ESPECIALLY athletes. An easy way this could be implemented is just distance and time, it doesn’t have to affect the charts.
- While there is a a feed, I wish there was a leaderboard, All time records between homies
- For beginner lifters using this app, add a tutorial video or gif showing how to do the exercise properly.
- Adding programs wouldn’t be a terrible idea either

Worries:
- with the implementation of a VIP system in the future, it’s worrisome that many of the amazing features could be pay walled or the app will be overran with adds

content.text:
FOR THE CUSTOMER: Given this app is still very early in its stages, this app is a gold mine for the gym community. I have already been advertising this to my friends as if I created it due to how long I’ve been waiting for something like this. If you are a long time gamer turned gym rat, you will love this apps creativity at utilizing an xp system and allowing you to unlock multiple different types of trophies.

FOR THE DEVELOPER: PLEASE KEEP UPDATING THIS APP. I am having so much fun so far and I really need more updates involving content and more unlockables. I think this game would thrive if it stays to a more single player route. Due to it needing an honor system to follow, adding any sort of pvp aspect or even leaderboards would be useless due to the dishonesty of a few. If you guys made this game more intricate in its actual ‘game-like’ style by expanding on the xp and trophy system, I think this would explode. 

Nonetheless, thank you for making something so awesome

Love this app

FOR THE DEVELOPER: PLEASE KEEP UPDATING THIS APP. I am having so much fun so far and I really need more updates involving content and more unlockables. I think this game would thrive if it stays to a more single player route. Due to it needing an honor system to follow, adding any sort of pvp aspect or even leaderboards would be useless due to the dishonesty of a few. If you guys made this game more intricate in its actual ‘game-like’ style by expanding on the xp and trophy system, I think this would explode.

Nonetheless, thank you for making something so awesome

title: Great idea, just needs more features

content.text: Love the idea of a social gym app, only problem for me personally is I've always used RepCount to log my workouts and that's what I'm gonna continue to use until more features get added. Levels has the basics, but RepCount has so much more with the ability to specify warmups/dropsets, add notes to each set, name workouts, show what weights/reps you previously did, allowing you to log multiple workouts per day, specify what time you started and stopped, etc. Obviously this app just launched but if those features which I personally find essential in a workout logging app don't get added, Ill have to stick with RepCount for now. Overall I was super hyped for the app when I saw it on TikTok and I still am but I definitely need some better features before I can start logging my workouts with it.

title: Would rate higher but severe issue

content.text: This app is nice, and really sophisticated, but there is a killer flaw. It’s impossible to go back and edit a recent workout. My friend and I wanted to see what would happen if we input something crazy, but it just saved it and it totally washed out my results. I went from brand new to level 280 with two diamond trophies. I can’t fix it, either, because my account can’t be deleted as far as I can tell. I also know the only way my review would receive attention is through a critical review, and I will adjust it accordingly should this change occur.

title: Sometimes doesn’t register parts of my workout

content.text: Just used it for the first time. Love the idea, but when I hit finish workout I found the final stats ignored some significant parts of my workout. It showed no sign I ever did barbell bench even though I specifically logged all the weights and sets I did. It also messed up some of my other rep and set counts that I logged. As a result, my final volume was about 6000 pounds below where it should have been when I did the math myself.

content.text: I downloaded this a few days ago and I absolutely love it. The whole concept of tracking your workouts and getting rewarded for it via trophies and “% worked out” if a very interesting touch. It does a great job of motivating you to get all %100 of your body worked out throughout the week. The social aspect of it, adding friends and seeing their workouts, is a great addition to an already impressive app. Though it is in the early stages, this app is going places and could be one of the best fitness apps in the industry. It really is a great app and I highly suggest you download it.

content.text: First off the progress tracking in the app is fantastic. Being able to track progression over time in many different areas is so beneficial to the user. And the concept of friends in the app is great for accountability and healthy competition. The app almost turns exercise into a game with attainable trophies for certain feats or goals that encourages the user to reach that next “level” and set new goals. I believe it will also be very lucrative to the personal training industry with the apps large exercise bank and planning pre saved workouts. I have been using regularly since it launched and I can’t wait to see how the app continues to develop.

I believe it will also be very lucrative to the personal training industry with the apps large exercise bank and planning pre saved workouts. I have been using regularly since it launched and I can’t wait to see how the app continues to develop.

content.text: I have been following “lvlup” or now officially known as “levels” for awhile now. I originally found out about this amazing app when it was still in beta through a few gym friends. These friends used “lvlup” almost everyday and I got to know it by watching them. I got in touch with the app creator via instagram and he is the most amazing person ever. I 100% believe that this app has been well thought through and developed. Personally I do prefer the “lvlup” name over the “levels” name, but, I am over the top excited that it is officially out of beta and can not wait to use it in the gym tomorrow. With all being said, I do 100% recommended using this app and finding friends to compete with.
content.html:
100% the best gym app
